    • areEnemiesAliveInDivision

      Returns true if there are any alive enemies in the given division.
      Parameters:
      division - the division to check
      Returns:
      true if there are alive enemies in the given division, false otherwise

    • setStartDivision

      public void setStartDivision(String startDivision) throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException

      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(Player player)
      Sets the player of this mission.

      This method is used to set the player of the mission when the mission is started.

      Parameters:
      player - the player of the mission

    • hasFoundTarget

      public boolean hasFoundTarget()
      Checks if the player has found the target of the mission.

      This method will return true if the player has found the target of the mission, false otherwise.

      Returns:
      true if the player has found the target, false otherwise

    • printInfo

      public void printInfo()
      Prints detailed information about the mission. This includes the mission code, version, target type, number of divisions, number of enemies, and number of exit-entry points in the building.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver() throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
      Checks if the game is over.

      The game is over if the player is dead or if the target has been found and the player is in an exit-entry division.

      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise
      Throws:
      Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if the building is empty

    • getAliveEnemies

      public Structures.ArrayList<Enemy> getAliveEnemies()
      Returns a list of enemies that are currently alive.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Enemy objects representing the alive enemies

    • getTurnCount

      public int getTurnCount()
      Returns the current turn count.
      Returns:
      the current turn count

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Increments the turn count.

      This method is called after each turn in the mission.

    • displayMissionMap

      public void displayMissionMap() throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
      Displays the mission map by iterating over the building's divisions. This method constructs a visual representation of the building's divisions and their connections using a breadth-first search (BFS) traversal. It begins by checking if the building graph is empty and then proceeds to build and print the header and rows that represent each division and its connections. Each division is displayed with its name and index, along with indicators of its connections to other divisions.
      Throws:
      Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if the building graph is empty
